oai_dc:dc.dc:title: PREDICTION OF COASTLINE EVOLUTION FOR THE HOLLAND COAST
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Dijkman, M.J.
Bakker, W.T.
de Vroeg, J.H.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: coastline evolution
Dutch Coast
evolution prediction
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: The Coastal Defence Study, as executed in the Netherlands, involved a 100-year prediction for the coastline evolution of specific parts of the Holland coast. In order to create this prediction a mathematical two-line model was used. In this model the effects of wave driven as well as tidal transports are incorporated, also cross-shore transport is implemented. The model is calibrated using sand balances, derived from measurements of coastal profiles. Qualitatively correspondence is reached, but quantitative differences between model and nature remain.
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: Coastal Engineering Proceedings; No. 22 (1990): Proceedings of 22nd Conference on Coastal Engineering, Delft, The Netherlands, 1990.
